project.teaser: Europe is in a time of dramatic change, war, economic crisis, climate change, migration, digitalisation, pandemics, ageing and demographic change, place increasing stress and pressure on our societies to adapt to fast-changing situations. Particular vulnerable groups in the...
project.objective:
Europe is in a time of dramatic change, war, economic crisis, climate change, migration, digitalisation, pandemics, ageing and demographic change, place increasing stress and pressure on our societies to adapt to fast-changing situations. Particular vulnerable groups in the general population are especially at risk of being disadvantaged by dramatic societal change, of experiencing particular stressors, and of suffering (further) negative impacts on their wellbeing, including mental health.
Members of MENTBEST have researched, created and delivered community-based interventions to reduce depression and suicidal behaviour. These interventions have been implemented and proven effective in 120 communities across 17 EU countries.
Building on this experience and intervention framework (EAAD 4-Level-Intervention), the MENTBEST consortium will (a) characterise the scale of the change-related mental health challenges; (b) work with patients, healthcare and other stakeholders to identify interventions and tools that can best build resilience and maintain mental health; (c) combine these interventions with an adapted and broadened EAAD 4 Level Intervention into a comprehensive community-based intervention (COMBINA) (d) deliver and validate COMBINA in five model regions, across five countries, with particular analysis of the benefits for vulnerable groups.
An innovative addition will be the RCT of app-based self-monitoring and self-management technologies for mental health, which use AI and n=1 longitudinal statistics to create individualised predictive models and provide users preventive and self-management support.
After validation and process evaluation, enhanced COMBINA will be a ready-to-use package which can be adopted throughout Europe and beyond. MENTBEST will inform a comprehensive communication,dissemination and policy-input programme to maximise impact, building on our relevant experience at all levels, from public outreach to government and EU policy.
project.title: Protecting mental health in times of change
project.keywords: resilience, community-based interventions, protecting vulnerable groups, mental self-care

article.title: Innovative interventions to protect mental health

result.title: Two Scoping Reviews
result.description: Report on systematic literature searches: one on the prevalence of sub-diagnostic mental health conditions and mental health challenges of dramatic change, and the other on mental health in vulnerable groups and relevant published interventions.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - MENTBEST (Protecting mental health in times of change)
result.teaser: Europe is in a time of dramatic change - war, economic crisis, climate change, migration, digitalisation, pandemics, ageing and demographic shifts, collectively place increasing stress and pressure on our societies to adapt to fast-changing situations.MENTBEST is designed to...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: MENTINA Trial study initiation package and ethical approvals report
result.description: Study initiation report for the MENTINA study, including ethical approvals and supporting documentation (RCT protocol, SOPs, participant information, etc).

result.title: Report on the data collection and analysis
result.description: Description of how the data in Task 1.3 has been collected, quality assured and aggregated.

result.title: Report on establishment of Co-Creator Network
result.description: Description of how the PRODUCES framework is used in the co-creation of COMBINA and MENTINA, and how purposeful sampling is used to recruit co-creators into the network.

result.title: MENTINA Trial centres setup report
result.description: Report on the setup of the Trial Centres for MENTINA trial, including recruitment of participants, review of MENTINA application by Centre personnel. Study centres will be set up in Denmark (Psychiatric Center Copenhagen), Germany (Depression Research Centre, Department of Psychiatry, University Hospital, Goethe University, Frankfurt am Main) and Spain (Institute of Neuropsychiatry and Addiction, Barcelona).

result.title: Publicly available data resource
result.description: An aggregated single data resource containing the data collected in Task 1.4.

result.title: Project Handbook
result.description: This Handbook provides templates and details for meetings, deliverables, reports, time-recording, etc. It complements the legal basis of the Consortium Agreement and DoA.

result.title: COMBINA Implementation Initiation Report
result.description: Study initiation report, including ethical approvals and supporting documentation (protocol, participant information, list of translated languages and vulnerable groups).

result.title: Depression-related self-help content in English and ready for localisation
result.description: Content for the MENTINA application, focused on depression and pre-depression, including psychoeducational materials, Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT)-based self-management elements adapted from the iFightDepression tool, as well as further self-management elements addressing distress and sub-diagnostic depressive symptoms.

result.title: Selected interventions Report
result.description: List of interventions reviewed and considered, with criteria for selection and eventual list of interventions selected for COMBINA.

result.title: MENTBEST Website
result.description: Project dedicated website online, plus a short report presenting the website and social media networks established to communicate the project and its activities.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
